question: If given an option, Socrates, would you live your life differently so as to escape your impending death sentence?
If you could go back in time, Socrates, would you change your approach to imparting knowledge to the youth?
What was the accusation of impiety and corrupting the youth based on, Socrates?
Socrates, when did you first discover your deep passion for questioning and understanding?
Socrates, what's the most challenging dialogue you've had and why?
Socrates, how would you define the concepts of virtue and morality?
Can you tell us, Socrates, about the biggest challenge you have faced in your philosophical journey?
Would you say your philosophy had the same level of acceptance privately as it did publicly?
As a philosopher, Socrates, how do you react to the contradicting interpretations of your philosophies?
Socrates, how did your belief in ethics impact your relationships in prison?
Socrates, if you had the chance to save yourself, would you escape or accept your sentence?
Socrates, who do you consider your biggest influence in Philosophy?
If you could change the end of your story, how would it affect your relationships?
Socrates, what principles do you hold most dear in your life?
Socrates, how do you think your philosophical teachings influenced your followers' relations with others?
Socrates, you are known to have authored no texts. How do you remember all your philosophical ponderings and dialogues?
Socrates, how would you react to someone condemning philosophy?
In your views, Socrates, what is the biggest flaw in Athenian society?
How did people generally respond to your style of probing into subjects?
How did the charges of impiety and corrupting the youth affect your relationships with others?
Having contributed so much to philosophy, Socrates, how do you feel about not authoring any texts?
How did these contradictions contribute to what we now know as the Socratic problem, Socrates?
If you had to choose, Socrates, would you prefer a life of ignorance or a life full of wisdom along with its subsequent pain?
How did your philosophical ideas evolve over time, Socrates?
Socrates, how important is truth in one's life from your perspective?
We've heard Plato and Xenophon were two of your students. What were they like, Socrates?
Tell me about your students. How would you describe your relationship with them, particularly Plato and Xenophon?
How did you react to these accusations, Socrates?
What was your defense during the trial, Socrates?
How did you feel on your last day in prison, Socrates, and why did you refuse offers to escape?
In your opinion, Socrates, how did your philosophies become instrumental in forming the foundation of Western philosophy?
As a polarizing figure, how did people treat you? How did that impact your interpersonal relationships?
Socrates, how did your parents' influence shape your mode of relating with others?
Can you share more about your method of questioning, Socrates?
In your opinion, Socrates, what is the biggest virtue a person can possess?
Socrates, what role did your question-and-answer style play in your interpersonal relationships?
Can you tell us about your most interesting dialogue, Socrates, and why it stands out for you?
How do you reconcile with the controversial interpretations of your talks, Socrates?
As a founder of Western philosophy, what are the key values you influence your interpersonal relationships with?
Did you ever feel misunderstood in your interpersonal relationships because of your philosophical approach?
Can you tell us more about your trial in 399 BC, Socrates?
Socrates, when sentenced to death, how did you accept this verdict?
Socrates, in retrospect, would you have amended your ideologies to fit better within Athenian society and possibly positively impact your relationships?
Socrates, could you explain your viewpoint on the meaning and purpose of human life?
How was your relationship with those who accused you of impiety and corrupting the youth?
As a moral philosopher, how did your interpretation of ethics play a role in your relationships?
How did you handle the negative perceptions some people had about you in Athenian society?
Can you talk about the significance of your philosophical work in shaping the thoughts of scholars who came after you, Socrates?
Socrates, how do you think your philosophy and teachings have shaped the Western world?
Socrates, what's your opinion on becoming such a significant figure in Western philosophy?
